caption: We arranged several events here: our wedding party, our book club event, our networking events and our farewell party. It has been always so easy to work with them and they were always super helpful. That‚Äôs why we have been there for several times for our precious events! Thank you, team!
A really cool place. Looks like it provides a great atmosphere in the evening.
Nice caf√© on a boat on the River. Very close to the Eiffel Tower.

It is a boat like no other in the area. ‚ú®Ô∏è You can admire the view from the rooftops, enjoy the night with friends from the multiple spaces and terrace, visit an exhibition in the boat hold - free and open to all visitors.ü§ì Next time you are near the Pont Alexandre III in Paris, don't forget to check how much you will enjoy this beautiful place.
My absolutely favorite place in Paris to grab a drink. Immaculate vibes and drinks for reasonable prices. Always busy in the evenings.
This is a Must. When in Paris, enjoy the vibe, the music and good drink from a rooftop of a boat parked to the margin of the Seine.

Really great place. Nice and interesting art expositions. Access is free. The location is amazing, along the river Seine. Huge terrace to have a snack or a drink. Prices a very reasonable and quality is good. I would definitely recommend a visit.
Great place to chill would have drink more but we had to go to the Eiffel Tower.

Fluctuart is a nice stop off the river after a hot day at the museums of Paris! We enjoyed a charcuterie tray and couple of  drinks. Service is a little challenged during busy hours but that didn't dampen our enthusiasm for the view and atmosphere.

We went there at night, where it turns into a rooftop/bar by the Seine. Music is very nice, it's not loud music at all though. You order from the waiter and then when the beeper rings, you go pick up your drinks from the bar. Very nice place
Wonderful exhibition space sitting on the Seine. Great caf√© and terrace on the top. Excellent to see and meet Paul Stone, known as 'My Dog Sighs'

Favorite place in Paris, and we were lucky enough to find it by accident. This converted riverboat gallery has an eclectic mix of street art and sculpture, a small boutique with books and prints, and a bar for caf√© and alchoholic beverages.

Cool place, very unique! Enjoyed a drink on the top deck while watching boats go by. Server was great and it was a nice relaxing time. Drink was also reasonably priced...9‚Ç¨ for an Aperol Spritz... I typically pay at least $10 for them anywhere else.  Heads up: Lots of levels and stairs, and the bathroom area is unisex.

A good place to come and enjoy a drink with a gorgeous view onto the Seine! The drinks are quite expensive for what they are, so you're pretty much paying for the location üòâ You can also visit a gallery and a bookshop on the ground floors. All in all, a really pleasant spot to take a break from a long walk at the Seine on a sunny day ‚òÄ üòä
It's was a good time!
Celebrated my 35 there. Two word. JUST FABULOUS !
Somewhere different to visit and have lunch on the South Bank of the Seine. Tasty food, reasonable prices, and a free to view urban art gallery, all on a floating pontoon.
Fantastic museum on a boat, right on the seine. The main exhibits were phenomenal, the bookshop was also substantial.

A hidden gem. Better to know French if you want to really understand what's going on as the captions don't have English versions, but the concept of the place is amazing. Go here when you get tired of traditional art experience in Paris, and you won't regret it. There is also a nice bookshop with titles on street art, graffiti culture, hip-hop, tattoo art, etc.
Interesting and free exhibition. Good to share a drink on the rooftop. Late projection on the walls at night. (Only open during summer holidays)
Nice floating art place on the river. Nice bar on the 3rd floor with fairly priced home wine, other drinks are expensive as usual touristy places. Food is served as well. Forth a quick visit.

Great bookstore of graffiti artists. Fun, lively spot to have a drink though there was a line to get in and it felt very scene-y and unrelated to the art. Took a long time to get drinks. You have to flag down a server who takes your order on an iPad, then they give you a buzzer. When your drink is ready, you go to the bar to retrieve it. The spritz was small and watery. Order a beer. Still a pretty beautiful location on the Seine for gathering. I loved when the boat swayed, reminding you you are definitely on a boat!
Quick stop for drink and snack. Nice spot after long walk to have lovely salad and drink. Fresh food and nice drink. Friendly service , lovely place.
Nice place to go for a drink and at the same time see artworks with a professional guide! Super idea. Normal prices for bars near the Quai
It is a nice place, near the river. As always the problem is the service. This time for example, we waited 40 min for our order and we had to go to the bar to get it :(
The unconvenrional idea of mixing art gallery to a bar in a boat has mase this place very special!  Be shre to visit the galleries and then grab your drink at the rop floor!
Great space with contemporary art and installations. Tiny bar up top to take a break from touring.

The idea is great. But they don't allow people to visit the terrace unless they have a specific type of reservation or VIP code that we never understood how to get. We assume they do some kind of profiling to allow access. We had a qr code from an app that granted access to the venue during a party that was supposed to start from 19:00 but they didn't let us in before 21:30 and never to the terrace. The gallery was closed. The floating building flushes to the river, polluting the water. Its impact is huge as the floating cushions placed to absorb pollutants show. The place is overrated, it is not inclusive and they should seriously revise their access policies. Staying in the terrace is ok for everyone, but access to the floating premises is based on hidden codes that establish hierarchies and that is social exclusion, period.
Bar service was poor. Substituted branded beverages for poor quality versions (fake ‚ÄòAperol‚Äô spritz). Staff were rude. Took a food order, paid, but dish wasn‚Äôt available. Would not recommend.

Very cool spot for sunset and evening drinks on the top deck of the peniche. They offer a few options for nibbles (mixed cheese & cold cuts), pok√© bowl, etc. And various cocktails, mocktails, beers and other options drinks.
Audio describing the scenes not sufficient.  1 universal language, English would be ideal.
Great bar and cocktails! Higly recommend Ben!!!
Great service, and the Mexican bar man was really amazing.  Greetings from IndianRomanian Couple
Great venue - street art museum and library in front of Alexander III bridge on the Seine - great bar on the rooftop - super artworks from Shepard Fairey, Invader, Banksy, etc.
My favorite gallery - amazing pieces, perfect location.
Ben is the best bartender !! Such a vibe this place:)
Great spot to check out a few exclusive street art masterpieces and have a few drinks on the river.
Very nice place! Art and beer are both on the same level - excellent! Same is true for service of course!
